page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO BRENTWOOD
page.content: { Brentwood}is situated in the county of Essex,about 30 km NE of London.It has a population of about{72,000}.Many of these commute to London every week day,either on British Rail or by car on the newly built M25 or the A12.Some people work locally in the Thermos Factory or in the shops or schools. The busiest part of the town is the High Street which contains most of the shops and services.In the central area there are five churches including a Roman Catholic Cathedral and the Parish Church of St.Thomas.The schools include a Catholic girls,an independent boys,a mixed comprehensive and four junior schools.Also a College of Further Education. Weald Park,to the West of Brentwood is part of London's{Green Belt}.It contains a lake with fishing,open space for recreation and woodland.
